description: Override compliance level definitions for your environment. This file allows customization of compliance levels and their allowed combinations.

levels.name: Public
levels.description: Publicly accessible data, no restrictions. Use for public-facing applications.

levels.name: External
levels.description: External services with basic enterprise security (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic)

levels.name: Internal
levels.description: Internal systems that can handle company IP information

levels.name: HIPAA
levels.description: HIPAA compliant systems for healthcare data. Can also use SOC2 resources.

levels.name: FedRAMP
levels.description: FedRAMP authorized systems for government data. Can also use SOC2 resources.

mode_description: Each compliance level explicitly defines which other levels can be used in the same session. For example, HIPAA can use HIPAA and SOC2 resources, but not Public or External to prevent data leakage.
